intro: Anemone coronaria var. mouansii, commonly known as the Mouansis anemone, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens.
